alert.note: Alert for Arapahoe (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:40PM MDT until August 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR CENTRAL ARAPAHOE AND SOUTH CENTRAL ADAMS COUNTIES... At 440 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Manila Village, or 24 miles east of Denver, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 428 PM MDT, a 66 mph wind gust was reported by an automated sensor in Bennett. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Aurora, Bennett, Watkins, Strasburg and Manila Village. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
